situation: F became distressed in a music class when the volume of the instruments was turned up to high.
action: The teacher aide asked F to pay attention and try to enjoy the music like everyone else, dismissing his visible discomfort.
effect: F covered his ears, becoming more agitated and unable to participate or engage in the class activity.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
